about_the_game:
FrameFusion Motion Interpolation improve the framerate of any video, gif or group of images by 2X/4X/8X/16X


The demo version contain everything from the full version but limit the output to 7 seconds at maximum.

This application that uses neural networks to generate optical flows between two frames of a video. By using these flows, the application merges the frames into a new one, effectively increasing the number of frames in the video output.

The application allows you to select multiple videos, GIFs, or images in formats like PNG/JPG/BMP for interpolation, producing a new video with a higher FPS than the original.

Key Features:
  • Choose from four different models for interpolation: options for live-action or animation, with the ability to render in high quality or with faster speeds.
  • Optimized for Nvidia GPUs with CUDA support but also compatible with AMD GPUs and CPUs.
  • Manage a queue of files for batch processing, with a progress bar to track how long each file will take.
  • For static images like PNG, you can select a folder of files and manually choose an FPS to use.

Export Options:
  • Export Frames: Generates a .PNG file for each processed frame, including the newly interpolated ones.
  • Export Motion Flow: Exports a PNG visualization of the optical flow.
  • Export Video Side-By-Side: Exports the original video alongside the interpolated video for comparison.
  • Export Video Cut in Half: Exports the left side of the video as the original and the right side as the interpolation, split down the middle for comparison.

Video Modifications:
  • Perfect Loop Video: Creates new frames between the last frame and the first frame of a video to create a perfect loop.
  • Remove Static Frames: Especially useful for animations, this option removes static frames to enhance the fluidity of the final video.
  • Skip Scene Changes: Detects scene changes and avoids interpolation to reduce artifacts in these transitions.

Supports frame multipliers, allowing you to output videos with higher FPS. For example, a video with 24fps can be interpolated to:
  • 2X: 48fps
  • 4X: 96fps
  • 8X: 192fps
  • 16X: 384fps

name: FrameFusion Motion Interpolation - Demo
short_description: Improve the framerate of any video, gif or group of images by 2X/4X/8X/16X using neural networks generating videos with a high FPS.The demo version contain everything from the full version but limit the output to 7 seconds at maximum.
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Korean, Spanish - Latin America, Japanese, Portuguese - Brazil, Russian
